Description:
General Summary
The Architectural Woodworking Project Manager & Technical Illustrator performs two jobs for Dovetail's custom wood shop: managing the production process and creating the shop drawings. This position requires project management experience as well as woodworking experience and technical drawing expertise. The wood shop supports Dovetail's residential and commercial projects and fabricates the custom casework, millwork, kitchens, baths, stairs, doors, tubs, furniture, and other architectural wood objects. Dovetail's wood shop is the place to realize high-craft designs and collaborate with master craftspeople. The shop is FSC certified and utilizes a range of fabrication methods, from CNC machining to Japanese joinery.

Job Description
This position is responsible for creating and maintaining the shop project schedules and project budgets. Works closely with the shop manager, shop production manager, architects, and clients to resolve design and construction issues. Coordinate, participate in, and document all project meetings. Manage all project communication, copy relevant parties, and follow up. Proactively communicate schedule changes. Track and report budget changes throughout project.

The position is also responsible for creating all shop drawings. Drives the fabrication process through proactive communication, manages the process through meetings and documentation, improves the drawings through soliciting feedback, and updates drawings accordingly. Attends pre-con meetings and visits job-sites. This position works closely with the shop team and reports directly to the shop manager.

Tasks
•	Track project estimates and budgets
•	Create and maintain project schedule. Update and communicate changes daily. Present schedule at weekly meetings. Post printed schedule in shop.
•	Interface daily with shop staff, update all on schedule and time-sensitive issues
•	Communicate effectively with architects and designers
•	Create and refine shop drawings
•	Synthesize project drawings and details
•	Create CAD to CAM workflow
•	Cost code all Timetracker data for wood shop
•	Visit job-sites as needed

Skills
•	Experience successfully leading and motivating a team
•	Experience successfully managing projects: establishing priorities, creating deadlines, and meeting them
•	Proficient with software: Excel; Project; Revit; Autocad; Sketchup; cloud-based systems
•	Experience with CNC machining and programming
•	Experience with 3-D BIM modeling a plus
•	Experience with change agreements and estimates
•	Excellent at time management, prioritizing, and multi-tasking
•	Team player, exceptional work ethic, always looking to improve
•	Experience and knowledge of building techniques, cabinet fabrication, joints, and details
•	Knowledge of logistics for shipping cabinets across North America
•	Comprehension of critical path and its relationship to cost, schedule, staffing, and maintenance
•	Forecast project challenges regarding staffing, budget, schedule and create solutions
•	Foster healthy relationships with project manager, architect, and client through project and beyond
•	Interpret plans, specifications, contracts, use Dovetail systems
•	Pro-active problem solver
•	Refined standards for quality, craft, aesthetics
•	Grace under pressure: display patience in an imperfect process and a desire to improve the process

Dovetail's Mission: Build the best utilizing the finest craftsmanship, with impeccable quality, environmental sustainability, and a commitment to lasting relationships.

About Dovetail: For 26 years Dovetail has been crafting fine residential and commercial projects throughout the Puget Sound. We specialize in custom, complex, architectural projects, with an FSC certified wood shop to support bespoke designs. 

Our expertise ranges from large-scale foundation work, structural steel, and architectural concrete, to fine finish carpentry and custom furniture. Dovetail's management is dedicated to honest, open communication, and leads with an inspired mission and vision. Here, we pursue our vocations and are committed to the success of each employee. Learn more about Dovetail here.

Benefits 
1.	Competitive compensation based on experience 
2.	Full benefits: medical, dental, vision 
3.	Paid vacation
4.	Company-match 401K

Apply: Please email resume with work history, employment dates, and references with "PM and Technical Illustrator" in the subject line.

Description:
Summary:
Access Laser, a leading provider of laser technology for industrial, scientific, and the medical markets seeks an experienced Electrical Engineer to develop novel mixed signal circuits for controlling RF excited molecular lasers.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
•	Work as part of a small dedicated engineering team to design, prototype, and test mixed signal control systems for molecular lasers.
•	Participate in all concept, preliminary, and critical design reviews.
•	Take on the role of project manager for specific projects as assigned.
•	Design mixed signal PCBAs (schematic capture, PCB layout, part specification and documentation).
•	Responsible for regulatory compliance for new products including laser safety and CE Mark.
•	Write test procedures and test reports for prototypes, first articles, and design verification/validation.
•	Release new designs using Agile PLM system.
•	Support production through NPI phase.

Necessary Qualifications:

•	BS in Electrical Engineering or related field.
•	Over 10 years experience designing and testing mixed signal PCBAs with at least 3 years acting as project manager.
•	Experience with CE Mark process and related harmonized standards.
•	Familiarity with EDA tools such as Altium, SPICE, and Xilinx ISE.
•	Experience writing technical reports.
•	Competent with test equipment for mixed signal circuits.
•	Ability and willingness to work in collaborative team environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

•	Strong analog skills including closed loop control systems.
•	Familiarity with FPGAs and CPLDs; literate in VHDL and Xilinx tools.
•	Experience writing firmware for microcontrollers (ASM or C++).
•	Experience with laser safety standard including CDRH and IEC 60825-1 for international compliance.
•	Experience using Altium with an SVN server and SolidWorks PDM Vault for version control.
•	Six Sigma Green Belt or experience using Six Sigma tools such as FMEA, DOE, and Process Maps.

A successful applicant must be able to routinely move equipment and raw material weighing up to 50 pounds.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or other classes protected by law.

Title: Project Engineer

Description:
General Summary
The Architectural Woodworking Project Manager & Technical Illustrator performs two jobs for Dovetail's custom wood shop: managing the production process and creating the shop drawings. This position requires project management experience as well as woodworking experience and technical drawing expertise. The wood shop supports Dovetail's residential and commercial projects and fabricates the custom casework, millwork, kitchens, baths, stairs, doors, tubs, furniture, and other architectural wood objects. Dovetail's wood shop is the place to realize high-craft designs and collaborate with master craftspeople. The shop is FSC certified and utilizes a range of fabrication methods, from CNC machining to Japanese joinery.

Job Description
This position is responsible for creating and maintaining the shop project schedules and project budgets. Works closely with the shop manager, shop production manager, architects, and clients to resolve design and construction issues. Coordinate, participate in, and document all project meetings. Manage all project communication, copy relevant parties, and follow up. Proactively communicate schedule changes. Track and report budget changes throughout project.

The position is also responsible for creating all shop drawings. Drives the fabrication process through proactive communication, manages the process through meetings and documentation, improves the drawings through soliciting feedback, and updates drawings accordingly. Attends pre-con meetings and visits job-sites. This position works closely with the shop team and reports directly to the shop manager.

Tasks
•	Track project estimates and budgets
•	Create and maintain project schedule. Update and communicate changes daily. Present schedule at weekly meetings. Post printed schedule in shop.
•	Interface daily with shop staff, update all on schedule and time-sensitive issues
•	Communicate effectively with architects and designers
•	Create and refine shop drawings
•	Synthesize project drawings and details
•	Create CAD to CAM workflow
•	Cost code all Timetracker data for wood shop
•	Visit job-sites as needed

Skills
•	Experience successfully leading and motivating a team
•	Experience successfully managing projects: establishing priorities, creating deadlines, and meeting them
•	Proficient with software: Excel; Project; Revit; Autocad; Sketchup; cloud-based systems
•	Experience with CNC machining and programming
•	Experience with 3-D BIM modeling a plus
•	Experience with change agreements and estimates
•	Excellent at time management, prioritizing, and multi-tasking
•	Team player, exceptional work ethic, always looking to improve
•	Experience and knowledge of building techniques, cabinet fabrication, joints, and details
•	Knowledge of logistics for shipping cabinets across North America
•	Comprehension of critical path and its relationship to cost, schedule, staffing, and maintenance
•	Forecast project challenges regarding staffing, budget, schedule and create solutions
•	Foster healthy relationships with project manager, architect, and client through project and beyond
•	Interpret plans, specifications, contracts, use Dovetail systems
•	Pro-active problem solver
•	Refined standards for quality, craft, aesthetics
•	Grace under pressure: display patience in an imperfect process and a desire to improve the process

Dovetail's Mission: Build the best utilizing the finest craftsmanship, with impeccable quality, environmental sustainability, and a commitment to lasting relationships.

About Dovetail: For 26 years Dovetail has been crafting fine residential and commercial projects throughout the Puget Sound. We specialize in custom, complex, architectural projects, with an FSC certified wood shop to support bespoke designs. 

Our expertise ranges from large-scale foundation work, structural steel, and architectural concrete, to fine finish carpentry and custom furniture. Dovetail's management is dedicated to honest, open communication, and leads with an inspired mission and vision. Here, we pursue our vocations and are committed to the success of each employee. Learn more about Dovetail here.

Benefits 
1.	Competitive compensation based on experience 
2.	Full benefits: medical, dental, vision 
3.	Paid vacation
4.	Company-match 401K

Apply: Please email resume with work history, employment dates, and references with "PM & Technical Illustrator" in the subject line.

Description:
Architect


Harris Group offers unique opportunities to grow professionally by working with diverse clients, projects, engineering disciplines and industries while living in some of the best places in the United States. Our size and the number of industries we are focused on allow you to be part of many different projects across a wide array of clients. Our team works closely to ensure our clients' projects are completed with the utmost professionalism, teamwork and detail design. If you are looking to take the next step in your career and are ready to join an exciting team with project diversity and professional growth opportunities, then Harris Group is for you!

Architect

Our Seattle, Washington office is looking for an Architect to join our team. This role works as part of multi-disciplinary project teams in the preparation of project deliverables, and will support the Senior Architect in producing designs of medium and heavy industrial projects, production laboratories, manufacturing facilities, and similar building types.

Essential Job Functions
 
    Define, organize, execute and coordinate architectural assignments.
    Work with Senior Architect to meet design and production goals.
    Interface with key client and project staff in formal, informal and project team meetings.
    Review work for design integrity, accuracy, clarity and quality.
    Conduct research and consult with specialists for assistance in document preparation.
    Inspect architectural features of structures in the field against construction documents.
    Regular and reliable attendance.
    Ability and willingness to travel to an off-site location and/or accept client site assignments when required.
    Ability to pass Client badging and screening processes.

Knowledge & Skills
 
    Advanced knowledge of architecture.
    Ability to apply architectural techniques commonly used in industrial capital projects.
    Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
    Ability to identify, interpret and apply relevant codes and standards to architectural designs.
    Proficient with MSOffice, AutoCAD, and manual sketches. Skill with Revit and Sketch-up is desirable.
    Able to consistently meet budgets and deadlines, completing tasks as previously defined.
    The ability to work independently with good judgment and strong customer focus is critical.

Education and Work Experience
 
    Bachelor's degree in Architecture, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
    Architectural license within two years preferred.
    3-6 years of work experience preparing construction documents and participating in design and construction support tasks.

Physical Requirements
 
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Work is performed mostly in office settings. Some outdoor work is required in the inspection of various land use developments, construction sites or public works facilities. Hand-eye coordination is necessary to operate drafting instruments, computers and various pieces of office equipment.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, feel or operate objects, tools or controls; and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; and smell.

The employee must occasionally lift and/or move objects up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

Travel can be required.

We look forward to receiving your resume!
 
Harris Group is an equal opportunity employer offering competitive salaries and excellent benefits.

All your information will be kept confidential and according to EEO guidelines. Harris Group is a Drug-Free Workplace.

Title: Architect

Description:
Interested in acting as sole engineering decision-maker for the 4th largest steel stud manufacturer in the U.S.? Steeler, Inc. is currently seeking a Structural Engineer. This person will be asked to produce structural engineering designs and modifications by identifying project objectives and issues, research and develop structural engineering techniques and approaches, and verify/validate designs. Candidates must have a Professional Engineering License, experience in the steel industry and knowledge about code compliance, including IBC, ASTM, AISI, UL, and local codes.

Duties:
* Completes feasibility studies by studying project concepts, objectives, priorities, and requirements; conducting site investigations; identifying and establishing performance standards; preparing construction documents and submittals.
* Organizes structural engineering design project by identifying short-term and long-range issues; preparing timetables, cost estimates, and required resources.
* Develops structural design plans by researching, analyzing, selecting, and applying structural engineering concepts, approaches, techniques, and criteria; adapting and modifying structural mechanics options; developing and evaluating new structural architectures and algorithms; performing design calculations relating to foundations and structures, loading, structural response, and connection design; preparing drawings and visualizations; collaborating with related engineering design teams; evaluating structural materials and suppliers; identifying and resolving design integration issues; determining and establishing design specifications and safety standards. * Verifies design by establishing functionality, reliability, maintainability, and durability test standards; building and testing simulations and models; performing analytical and numerical quantification procedures and visualizations; analyzing test data; identifying, isolating, and resolving problems.
* Verifies and supports construction by performing compliance inspections and tests; resolving construction problems related to structural design; coordinating and conferring with construction and production contractors.
* Fields customer inquiries and requests regarding the application and usage of our products, Troubleshoot for customers and sales staff, helping them pass building inspections. Assist sales staff in helping customers and answering questions about Steeler products.
* Documents structural design and maintenance by recording design features and maintenance requirements, and warnings; detailing safety requirements. Updates all Steeler documents relating to the steel design and testing standards.
* Complies with codes and regulations by applying and enforcing adherence to regulations and testing requirements; advising management on needed actions.
* Maintains engineering design team accomplishments by coordinating actions; obtaining expert input; reviewing open issues and action items; contributing information and structural engineering analysis to team meetings and reports; guiding structural engineering technicians.
* Prepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing structural engineering data and trends.
* Updates job knowledge by tracking and understanding emerging structural engineering technologies and practices; participating in educational opportunities and professional organizations; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks.
* Enhances engineering and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments. Skills/Qualifications: Site Development, Quality Engineering, Drafting Tools, AutoCAD, Analytical Tools, Estimating, Conceptual Skills, General Math Skills, Verbal Communication, Presentation Skills, Problem Solving, Customer Service and Relationship Building skills, Leadership and Guidance skills.
Required:
1. Professional Engineering License.
2. Pursue ICC-ES report update to ESR-2054.
3. Calculations and design tables for Steeler studs, tracks, joists and other products. Design tables include single span, double span, slip track gauge, connection capacities, allowable joist loads, web crippling, etc.
4. Acquire testing services when needed.
5. Assist customers in using Steeler, Inc. products. Troubleshoot for customers and help customers pass building inspections. Assist sales staff in helping customers and answering questions about Steeler products.
6. Experience with Microsoft Excel for design tables and streamlining product design
7. Knowledge about Code Compliance (IBC, ASTM, AISI, UL, local codes).
8. Knowledge about Contractor's process of acquiring work. Bidding process and understanding the relationships between the Project Owner, Architect, Structural Engineer, General Contractor, Sub-Contractor (Framer and drywaller), suppliers, manufactures, building officials, building inspectors, etc.
9. Knowledge of project specifications, product submittals, substitution process/paperwork/approvals, etc.
10. Prepare reports.
11. Must communicate effectively with internal employees. Be able to clearly communicate technical concepts, regulations, and testing requirements to non-engineers. Advise management team.
12. Must be organized and identify priorities.
Additional Duties (beneficial experience, but not required):
1. Fire and Sound assembly knowledge (UL and ASTM ratings of walls, ceilings, head-of-wall, shaftwall, etc).
2. AutoCAD (production drawings and/or details for customers).
3. Shop Drawings & Material Take-offs or acquiring these services for customers.
4. Cold-formed steel software (CFS, LGBeamer, AISIWIN, etc).
5. Building maintenance on Steeler structures and small improvement projects.
6. Experience with architectural and structural plans and details.


Steeler offers a full medical/dental/vision package, 401(k) with company match, paid vacation, paid sick, paid holidays, educational reimbursement, career growth opportunities and much more!

Description:
Notkin Mechanical Engineers is seeking a senior-level Mechanical Designer to join our team in downtown Seattle. We are a mid-sized, consulting mechanical design engineering firm with a rich, local history full of involvement in landmark projects for over sixty years. Today, Notkin's work spans the Pacific Northwest, as well as Alaska, California, and Hawaii.

We employ outstanding people who are committed to excellence. We offer competitive pay plus robust benefits, including partially-paid dependent health premiums, 401(k) match, paid time off, and more. For more information please see our web site: www.notkin.com

The Senior Mechanical Designer will assist Project Managers and Engineers in the production of complete design documents for HVAC, plumbing, and piping systems. The Senior Mechanical Designer will also participate in one or more projects assisting Engineers by performing a variety of tasks, such as the following, and may review or oversee the work of others as appropriate:

* Support Project Manager and Engineer on projects of all sizes
* Perform engineering calculations including but not limited to HVAC load calculations, pipe flow analysis, pipe stress analysis, psychometrics, and equipment sizing
* Select equipment
* System design and layout
* May edit specifications for project specific requirements
* May write reports and other forms of correspondence (e.g., letters, memos, meeting notes, etc.) 
* Responsible for compliance with codes, industry standards and guidelines
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date project information in projects binder including calculations
* May supervise or review the work of other internal design professionals working on the project to confirm design intent is progressing; assign and schedule work; establish project priorities
* Coordinate production of CAD drawings; review drawings and verify drawings are accurate
* May coordinate the mechanical design work with other disciplines (i.e., civil, structural, electrical, acoustical, etc.)
* May represent Notkin at owner/client meetings and keep meeting notes
* Report project status regularly to the Project Manager / Engineer (e.g., scope creep, staffing requirements, schedule issues, etc.)
* Review submittals (e.g., equipment/product, TAB reports and O & M manuals) and shop drawings for compliance with contract documents
* Prepare Opinion of Probable Construction Cost 
* Respond to RFI's
* Respond to bidding phase issues, including addendums
* Conduct construction site visits and write observation reports
* Responsible for quality control of their own work prior to submitting it for final quality control review by firm technical leader
* Review change order proposals
* May participate in presentations of technical approach for interviews and team project meetings
* May require travel out of state or within state to visit work sites
* Other duties as assigned

The successful candidate will have:

* Two-year technical degree or equivalent experience (minimum)
* 4-10 years' recent hands-on experience in the design and selection of mechanical equipment
* Knowledge and understanding of building codes, industry standards and practices
* Good communication skills; both verbal and written; ability to effectively communicate technical information with clients and design engineers 
* Ability to handle multiple priorities well
* Excellent organizational, analytical, and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and within a team 
* Proficient computer skills

Description:
Notkin Mechanical Engineers is seeking a Mechanical Designer to join our team in downtown Seattle. We are a mid-sized, consulting mechanical design engineering firm with a rich, local history full of involvement in landmark projects for over sixty years. Today, Notkin's work spans the Pacific Northwest, as well as Alaska, California, and Hawaii.

We employ outstanding people who are committed to excellence. We offer competitive pay plus robust benefits, including partially-paid dependent health premiums, 401(k) match, paid time off, and more. For more information please see our web site: www.notkin.com

The Mechanical Designer will assist Project Managers and Engineers in the production of complete design documents for HVAC, plumbing, and piping systems. The Mechanical Designer will also participate in one or more projects assisting Engineers by performing a variety of tasks, such as the following:

* Support Project Manager and Engineer on projects of all sizes
* Perform engineering calculations including but not limited to HVAC load calculations, pipe flow analysis, pipe stress analysis, psychometrics, and equipment sizing
* Select equipment
* System design and layout
* May edit specifications for project specific requirements
* May write reports and other forms of correspondence (e.g., letters, memorandums, meeting notes, etc.) 
* Responsible for compliance with codes, industry standards and guidelines
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date project information in projects binder including calculations
* Coordinate production of CAD drawings; review drawings and verify drawings are accurate
* May coordinate the mechanical design work with other disciplines (i.e., civil, structural, electrical, acoustical, etc.)
* May attend owner/client meetings and keep meeting notes
* Report project status regularly to the Project Manager/Engineer (e.g., scope creep, staffing requirements, schedule issues, etc.)
* Review submittals (e.g., equipment/product, TAB reports and O&M manuals) and shop drawings for compliance with contract documents
* Prepare Opinion of Probable Construction Cost 
* Respond to RFIs
* Respond to bidding phase issues, including addendums
* Conduct construction site visits and write observation reports
* Responsible for quality control of their own work prior to submitting it for final quality control review by firm technical leader
* Review change order proposals
* May participate in presentations of technical approach for interviews and team project meetings
* May require travel out of state or within state to visit work sites
* Other duties as assigned

The successful candidate will have:

* Two-year technical degree or equivalent experience (minimum)
* 1-2 years of recent hands-on experience in the design and selection of mechanical equipment
* Knowledge and understanding of building codes, industry standards and practices
* Good communication skills; both verbal and written; ability to effectively communicate technical information with clients and design engineers 
* Ability to handle multiple priorities well
* Excellent organizational, analytical, and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and within a team 
* Proficient computer skills

Description:
NOW HIRING!
Project Manager - Senior Engineer - Seattle
It's an exciting time to be in the marine business and Elliott Bay Design Group (EBDG) is seeking a senior level engineer to join its team of professionals. EBDG is an employee-owned firm providing unparalleled naval architecture, marine engineering and production support services on behalf of owners, operators, and shipyards across the country.
The person who fills this role will lead project teams in the development of new commercial vessel designs, and modification and support of existing vessels. This individual will also provide senior engineer leadership of structural design, analysis and standards development. Work will primarily be in our Seattle office with frequent travel for field engineering, troubleshooting, testing and physically demanding inspections aboard ships and in shipyards. Our team-based approach empowers staff to work both independently and as part of an interdisciplinary group. You will be working closely with a team of experienced naval architects, marine engineers, electrical engineers and marine designers and have the opportunity to manage relationships with existing customers as well as to actively pursue new opportunities with potential customers.

The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:
 More than ten years of experience in commercial vessel design and a BS degree in Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering or a related degree.
 Four or more years of experience as a project manager. CAPM or PMP certification is a plus. Once hired working toward and obtaining PMP certification is expected.
 PE license. If licensed in another jurisdiction than Washington, the candidate must have the ability of becoming a Washington licensed PE by comity. PE in Naval Architect and Marine Engineer is a plus but not required.
 Proven ability to design and arrange details for primary and secondary ship structure. Candidate must be able to develop supporting calculations for required scantlings and welds based on first principles as well as class society rules
 Proven extensive structural FEA analysis experience. Experience using ANSYS is a plus.
 Experience managing a technical team for completion of a complex vessel design from initial concept through completion of detailed design for production
 Experience with SOLAS, USCG-inspected vessel regulations and ABS class rules
 Experience with naval architectural support for common shipyard activities such as dry dockings, repairs, stability tests and vessel inspections
 Experience developing detailed project proposals and budgets
 Experience negotiating engineering and contractual issues
 Proficiency with MS Office software including Project

In addition to the above requirements, strong candidates will also possess the experience described below:
 Construction cost estimate development and evaluation of shipyard change proposals
 Motions/wave, fatigue, mooring loads, CFD, GHS analysis experience
 Working knowledge of AutoCAD

An ability to travel with little notice is a must for this position. The successful candidate will have excellent writing skills. This is a full-time employee position.

Along with competitive salary, EBDG offers full benefits and a culture of innovation and involvement. We believe that investing in our employees is paramount so we offer the following:
 Training and mentoring programs to support our staff's goals and objectives
 Open Book Management
 Strong support for continuing education and training
 As an employee-owned company future ownership opportunities may be available

We work together and we play together. Every year we schedule a number of activities that add to the enjoyment of EBDG employment. In between the scheduled events we experience random acts of celebration and camaraderie.
EBDG's Seattle office is located in the dynamic Ballard neighborhood and comes with plenty of FREE parking. Our office in New Orleans is located in the heart of the Central Business District and is close to all that the city has to offer.
Elliott Bay Design Group LLC is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce.

Send resumes in confidence to info@ebdg.com. No 2nd party referrals, please.
For more information please visit EBDG on the web at www.ebdg.com.

Description:
Harder Mechanical, founded in 1934, is one of the oldest continuously operating mechanical construction companies in the United States. We are recognized as a leader in high-tech, commercial and industrial construction, successfully managing projects throughout the United States. We have been consistently ranked among the top 50 subcontractors by Engineering News Record.

We have immediate openings in our Portland (Oregon), Phoenix (Arizona) and Salt Lake City (Utah) locations for a Process Piping/Plumbing Detailer with experience in 2D CAD and 3D modeling software and areas of expertise in high-tech tool install process piping systems in new construction and/or retrofitting of existing facilities. This position offers an excellent opportunity for growth. We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a professional work environment. Qualified individuals are invited to apply in confidence, include a cover letter, resume, and daytime phone number.

Qualifications:
• Process Piping Detailing experience.
• Tool Install knowledge required. 
• Demonstrated experience in AutoCAD, AutoCAD MEP, and 3D Modeling software.
• Working knowledge of CADWorx Plant Professional software is preferred.
• Working knowledge of Quick Pen Pipe Designer 3D software is preferred.
• Experience with ISOGEN is preferred.

Responsibilities: 
Successful candidates will possess experience in industrial process piping and detailing, system layout, MEP coordination, and BIM. Applicants must be capable of creating detailed mechanical piping models, layouts, drawings, generating Bill of Materials (BOM) reports, and creating isometric spool drawings. Candidates must be highly motivated, have exceptional communication skills, flourish in problem solving situations, and possess a positive attitude.
Ideal individuals will have a minimum of 5+ years of experience with strong 3D piping knowledge and be capable of producing complex geometrical forms, identifying design issues, and providing virtual simulations in 3D. Proficient CAD drafting (Autodesk products preferred) and detailing skills in mechanical and process piping systems for high-tech projects is a must. Candidates will be required to demonstrate CAD skills during an interview.

Respond directly to this craigslist ad to submit your resume. For more information about Harder Mechanical, please visit our website www.harder.com

Harder Mechanical is an Equal Opportunity Employer with a strong commitment to a safe and drug-free workplace.

Description:
NOW HIRING!
Mid-Level Naval Architect/Marine Engineer - Seattle
Elliott Bay Design Group is a naval architecture and marine engineering firm located in the vibrant Ballard neighborhood.  We have a long history of providing vessel owners, operators and shipyards in the United States and beyond with exceptional design, engineering and production support.  Our team is unparalleled, and we are looking for an exceptional candidate to join us in the role of Naval Architect/Marine Engineer.

The ideal candidate will have a BS degree in Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering or a related degree.  Position requirements include:

•	Three plus years experience in ship design overall; experience at a shipyard in a production engineering support role is a plus.
•	Ability to design and arrange details for primary and secondary ship structure.  Candidate must be able to develop supporting calculations for required scantlings and welds based on first principles as well as class society rules
•	Experience with SOLAS, USCG-inspected vessel regulations and ABS class rules
•	Experience with outfitting and naval architectural support for common shipyard activities such as repairs, stability tests and vessel inspections is preferred
•	Experience developing calculations and the design of propulsion shafting, rudder and steering systems, piping and pump selection
•	Working knowledge of AutoCAD and GHS, familiarity with solids modeling using Rhino, FEA using ANSYS and CFD analysis is a plus

Work will primarily be in an office environment (5 days per week typically) with occasional travel for client and project meetings, inspections and testing.  An ability to travel with little notice is a must for this position.  The successful candidate will have excellent writing and oral communication skills and will be able to work both independently and with a team.  Must be a self-starter.  A career-oriented individual will have already passed the Fundamentals of Engineering exam (EIT) and intends to obtain a PE license when qualified.

Proof of eligibility to work in the USA is a requirement.  No second party referrals or contact, please.

This is a permanent position at EBDG.  You will be working closely with a team of experienced naval architects, marine engineers, electrical engineers and marine designers.

Along with competitive salary, EBDG offers full benefits and a culture of innovation and involvement.  We believe that investing in our employees is paramount so we offer the following:

•	Training and mentoring programs to support our staff's goals and objectives
•	Open Book Management
•	Strong support for continuing education and training
•	As an employee-owned company future ownership opportunities may be available

We work together and we play together.  Every year we schedule a number of activities that add to the enjoyment of EBDG employment.  In between the scheduled events we experience random acts of celebration and camaraderie. 

EBDG's Seattle office is located in the dynamic Ballard neighborhood and comes with plenty of FREE parking.  Our office in New Orleans is located in the heart of the Central Business District and is close to all that the city has to offer.

Elliott Bay Design Group LLC is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce.  

Send resumes in confidence to info@ebdg.com.  No 2nd party referrals, please.

For more information please visit EBDG on the web at www.ebdg.com.

Description:
Construction Safety Manager- New York, NY 

Site Safety Manager needed to support our client on multiple healthcare and laboratory renovation projects within Manhattan, NY.

Responsibilities:

    Evaluate, monitor the construction contractors' performance, as it relates to compliance with the Site Safety Specification for each contract and recognized laws and standards for construction. 
    Assess the contractors Accident Prevention (APP) and/or Construction Safety & Health Plan. 
    Establish and maintain a safety awareness and prevention program, to safeguard against work site safety incidents. 
    Evaluate the construction activity and prepare hazard analysis and technical positions on the appropriateness of the proposed mitigation strategies. 
    Provide continuous oversight to assure a robust Safety and Occupational Health Program. 
    Monitor the contractor's adherence to the contract safety requirements and report identified concerns and deficiencies Coordinate all Interim Life Safety Measures (ILSM) and maintain a system for traceable concurrence and adherence to the approved procedures for each activity. 


Skills and Knowledge:

    Ability to recognize potentially hazardous construction activity and perform a risk analysis as needed to assure the health and well-being of patience, visitors, staff and tradesmen. 
    Must maintain a working knowledge of major construction activity and the typical risk associated with specific construction activity. 
    Must have a working knowledge of the specific requirements and mitigations defined by current OSHA standards. 
    Certifications Shall be a Certified Safety Professional (CSP) and/or Certified Safety and Health Technician (CSHT) or be capable of obtaining either required certification within 6 months. Please provide a cover letter and indicate your ability to obtain either required certification within 6 months. 

Education:

    A degree in Construction Management, Architecture, or Engineering, from an accredited institution of higher learning.
    Other degrees will be accepted with relevant experience. 

Relevant Experience:

     A minimum of 10 year experience with related construction and facility safety and/or industrial hygiene experience.

Description:
New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure is currently seeking a project architect or engineer with 5 to 10 years of restoration experience.  

SUPERSTRUCTURES works on an array of challenging projects on many of New York's most prominent buildings. We've won frequent awards, as well as the loyalty of some of the premier clients in the region -- public, corporate and residential.  Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure - facades, roofs, windows, and plazas - and the full complement of materials, from landmark terra cotta to high performance curtain walls.  

We work in teams. Teams are assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a "small office experience" coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state of the art non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.  

Employees typically participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see the designs you draw executed in the field, and you'll take on greater responsibility and client exposure as soon as you are ready.  

Frequent lunchtime seminars by industry experts, including our own in-house personnel, keep us current on developments in the profession (with the additional benefit of a free lunch).  

SUPERSTRUCTURES offers top-level compensation for top-level people, and the advancement potential of a thriving company.  

We are committed to a work / life balance, and to a work week of 40 hours.  When, on occasion, more than 40 hours are required, our employees are compensated for every additional hour worked. 
Our benefits include paid holidays, vacation and sick days, health insurance for employee and family, 401(k) with automatic employer contribution, a continuing education allowance, and free NYC Transit MetroCards.  

Our light-filled office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and drop dead views in three directions - not a bad place to spend the workday. 

Our Tribeca location is one of New York City's most convenient and vibrant, easily accessible via public transportation. The A, C, and E subway lines stop right in the building. The N, R, #1, and #6 lines are each just a few blocks away. 

SUPERSTRUCTURES welcomes applications in reply to this posting. Please include a cover letter with salary requirements, your resume, and a few pages of attachments that display your capabilities (maximum of 10MB please).  

Note: Our thanks in advance to those submitting applications; only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.   

For additional information, visit our website at

We are a Building Code Consulting and Expediting firm in Manhattan and are currently seeking a full-time Project Supervisor to join our team of Project Managers. 

Project Supervisors are responsible for:
- Filing construction applications with DOB and LPC
- An understanding of the building code coupled with the processes of the Department of Buildings, Landmark Preservation Commission, and other city agencies 
- Review of filing drawings
- Prepare and assemble Alt 2 and Alt 3 applications for filing with various city agencies: DOB, LPC, DOT, etc.
- Process post-approval amendments
- Maintain client relations, answer questions and provide project status
- Maintain tracking for status of applications 
- Complete applications to gain approval
- Prepare and file reconsiderations
- Basic knowledge of construction means and methods and building codes

Qualifications:
- Must have a degree in either Architecture or Engineering
- Minimum of one (1) year of relevant experience in this industry
- Strong interpersonal, communicative, and writing skills
- Interested in networking and developing in New York's architecture scene

We're seeking someone with the desire and drive to become a long-term, indispensable member of our team. 

Compensation range is $40-45k, based on experience and education.

Hours are 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, Monday through Friday. Our firm offers full medical and dental benefits, long-term disability, and paid vacation. Please submit your resume, cover letter, and salary requirements.

Description:
Company
Think Construction is a mid-size construction company specializing in the renovation of townhouses, apartments, and boutique retail and office space in Manhattan and Brooklyn. Their work is very high quality and detail-oriented, ranging from very modern to traditional projects.  
The partners pride themselves on giving their customers individualized attention and support.  They are very personable, sincere and capable, and have spent years fine-tuning their team of project managers, site supervisors, and field workers. They take a very pro-active approach to the construction process and make a special effort to help architects, interior designers, and clients achieve the design goals of their projects.

Job Description
The Project Manager is the key part of our leadership team.  Working with the principals, field staff and accounting department, the Project Manager is responsible for the successful management of each project from start to finish. The Project Manager is our client's primary contact within our company and is responsible for maintaining the balance between design goals, project schedules, project finances, and client satisfaction.
Candidate must have 3+ years as a professional Project Manager in the construction industry, have excellent written and verbal communication skills, and possesses superior planning and organizational abilities. At Think Construction, we believe strongly in promoting a positive, respectful, supportive, collegial, and collaborative work environment -- an environment that encourages hard work, professionalism, and opportunities for continued learning and growth. And we like to have fun doing it. We look for candidates who share our vision and want to grow with us.

Job Responsibilities:
•	Manage and lead construction projects: coordinate construction efforts while ensuring the ongoing satisfaction of architects, owners, and other clients. 
•	Generate and maintain the project's schedule, budget, and supporting documents (RFIs, Submittals, etc.). Monitor the progress of these to ensure successful delivery of all projects on schedule and on budget.
•	Monitor project financial performance and take appropriate steps to maintain satisfactory performance of the project.
•	Prepare and negotiate all project agreements (based on existing company standard documents); make certain all parties understand the contents and limitations of agreement, subsequent Change Orders, etc.
•	Negotiate project schedule/deadlines with client and take primary responsibility within Think Construction for meeting agreed schedules.
•	Manage site teams (with the site supervisor) and take a lead role in scheduling and allocating resources for the project. Anticipate and be proactive about the needs of each site.
•	Maintain continuous dialogue between principals, site supers and clients, including scheduling and leading team meetings and maintaining project minutes, records and files.
•	Coordinate any outside Project Consultants (engineering, lighting, A/V, etc.).
•	Determine that applicable code issues have been properly reviewed and addressed.
•	Determine that project invoices have been properly vetted, prepared and sent to Bookkeeper. Help prepare Payment Requests.
•	Assist in preparing fee and agreement proposals; participate in other business development efforts as appropriate.
•	Supervise and mentor Assistant Project Managers in all aspects of the job.

Job Requirements:
•	Minimum 3 years experience in Project Management. High end residential construction expertise is a big plus, but will consider commercial PM experience if with a General Contractor
•	Thorough understanding of project management fundamentals, including project budgeting and scheduling, financial performance indicators, etc.
•	Deadline-driven critical thinking and ability to identify and articulate critical path issues.  
•	Team-oriented and collaborative, articulate, personable, professional, highly productive, and able to deal successfully with clients.
•	Strong sense of self-motivation and follow-through in a complex business environment; mature approach to managing priorities.
•	Ability to demonstrate spreadsheet and analysis skills related to project finances, staffing, etc.

is a role that is integral to our team. He or she coordinates pre-production by indexing parts and logging them in our in-house inventory system. Description:
New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure is currently seeking a project architect or engineer with 5 to 10 years of restoration experience.  

SUPERSTRUCTURES works on an array of challenging projects on many of New York's most prominent buildings. We've won frequent awards, as well as the loyalty of some of the premier clients in the region -- public, corporate and residential.  Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure - facades, roofs, windows, and plazas - and the full complement of materials, from landmark terra cotta to high performance curtain walls.  

We work in teams. Teams are assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. Description:
ARCHITECTS FOR HI-PROFILE CRYOGENIC PROJECT (THE TIMESHIP PROJECT)

The Stasis Foundation / Stephen Valentine Architect is seeking two qualified architects for a 650 acre parcel for the development of a sate-of -the-art biotechnology research park in Comfort, Texas. Please refer to the website, www.timeship.org. The range of duties varies, but could include some or all of the following:

* Design & Detail: Development for a new research building for the testing of cryonics capsules.
* Physical Model Building
* Space Planning Studies
* Materials Research
* Construction documents
* Property Infrastructure & Buildings to be designed
* Construction & Renovation Supervision of existing facilities.
* Supervision of Wind Turbine Testing for potential power suitability 

Job Position-1 (Senior Architect)

The ideal candidate will possess a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Architecture with at least eight (10) years of planning & construction experience is preferred. Bio-medical building experience would be helpful. Candidates must have an exceptional sense of art of design detailing, architecture & science. Additional infrastructure design development and construction documents skills would be required. Candidate must be meticulous to details and well organized. Experience with exceptional physical model building, graphic design, 3D modeling, and presentations are a plus. 

Candidate-2 (Junior/Intermediate Architect)

The ideal candidate will possess a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Architecture, and at least two (2) years of experience is preferred. Candidates must have an exceptional sense of art of design, architecture & science. Experience with exceptional museum quality of physical model building, graphic design, 3D modeling, and presentations are a plus. Construction documents skills would be required. Game engine experience using the software program Unity is a plus.

This position initially will be a full-time salaried contract consulting position.
Work will be done at either at the New York office or at the Timeship project site near San Antonio, Texas. Candidates will be working directly with New York architect Stephen Valentine.
Candidate must be very committed. E-mail resume with attached samples, but must have "DETAILED" letter of interest. The website is: www.timeship.org 
There is also an award winning book about the project titled: TIMESHIP [The Architecture of Immortality] published in 2009.

BACKGROUND INFORMATION
The Stasis Foundation Biotechnology Research Park (Stasis Research Park) will be a world-class biotech facility located near San Antonio, Texas.
There are two parts to the primary mission to the Stasis Research Park: biotech research and the cryostorage of biological materials. The design and development of cooling systems and devices for the cryopreservation & cryostorage of human organs for transplantation purposes , materials to support fertility; tissue for regenerative medicine; DNA, including the DNA of near extinct species; whole mammalian organisms including humans after legal death for whom all medical procedures have failed.

The Stasis Research Park is owned and managed by the Stasis Foundation, a federally tax exempt 501(c)(3) not-for-profit charitable corporation that conducts health and medical research.

Salary: Commensurate with experience

Interviews will be held in either Manhattan (NYC) or San Antonio, TX Please send via email. 

You must include the following supporting materials.

Letter of interest
Resume
Portfolio
3-References (professional)

- Experience must be from construction or project management in New York City
- Must have experience with the NYC Department of Buildings processes and procedures
- Must have at least an intermediate understanding of structure and construction

Our building surveyors measure existing buildings to produce as-built drawings. Data is collected in the field using a laser that inputs information directly into a pen tablet.

This position requires high attention to detail and good sense of direction and spatial orientation. Good physical condition is required as you will be walking a substantial amount. Description:
Morrison-Maierle has an exciting opportunity for an experienced professional to lead and grow our Water / Wastewater group in our Missoula, Montana office.

Morrison-Maierle is an employee-owned firm that has offered a broad range of engineering design services for over 70 years. Morrison-Maierle serves the Western United States from offices in Billings, Bozeman, Great Falls, Helena, Kalispell, and Missoula Montana, Casper, Cody, Gillette, and Sheridan, Wyoming, Spokane, Washington, and Phoenix, Arizona. 

We have built our reputation on creating engineering solutions that build better communities.  As a regional firm, Morrison-Maierle has approximately 300 employee-owners and is currently ranked within the Engineering News Record's "Top 500 Design Firms" and named as one of the "Best Firms to Work For" by the Zweig Group.      

Opportunity	

This position assumes the responsibility to lead and grow our Water / Wastewater Market Group in the Missoula office.  This position often coordinates with staff in all Morrison-Maierle offices.  The position reports directly to the Missoula Operations Manager with frequent communication/coordination to the Water/Wastewater Market Group Leader. 

Specific responsibilities include:

•	Providing general supervision of project managers and ensuring projects are completed in accordance with client requirements and company policies and standards.

•	Monitoring quality assurance and risk management procedures.

•	Communicating with and directing staff on business development, project schedules, staffing capacity needs, new work, and client relations.

•	Performing as Client Service Manager, Project Manager and Project Engineer as necessary.

•	Initiating, managing and assisting in building client relationships, including maintaining, expanding and enhancing existing client relationships, forging new relationships with prospective clients and securing profitable new work.

•	Tracking, managing and maintaining assigned group utilization, net labor multiplier, and revenue efficiency factor goals as well as individual goals for the Missoula Office Water/Wastewater Group.

•	Assisting the Operations Manager with personnel management including recruitments, salary reviews, scheduling training, conducting annual employee check-ins and mid-year follow up, and establishing annual individual staff goals.

•	Assists and coordinates with the Market Group Leader on business development opportunities, expanding and enhancing existing client relationships, client service, preparation of proposals, qualifications and interviews. 

•	Assists in the development of Market Group business development plans.

•	Provides input on the selection of Client Service Managers (CSMs) and Project Managers (PMs) to MGL and OM.

•	Attends and actively participates in Market Group meetings.  Communicates with office staff on Market Group performance related to business development, project workload, financial and related matters.

•	Overseeing the office group's financial performance and working with the Operations Manager to meet yearly financial goals and budget.

•	Mentoring less experienced staff in technical, business development, project management, and other professional arenas.


Qualifications	

B.S. Degree or equivalent in Civil Engineering.  Registered Professional Engineer.  

Appropriate and relevant professional experience in delivering consulting services in the Water/Wastewater markets or closely related field.  Previous group management experience preferred but not required.

The successful candidate will possess strong business development skills, a thorough understanding of water/wastewater funding sources and strategies, and a proven track record of excellent client service; demonstrate the ability to maintain a positive group culture, and to coalesce and mentor a variety of staff to achieve client, company, market group, and Missoula Office goals.

Location	Missoula, Montana

An Equal Opportunity Employer for Minority / Female / Disability / Veterans

What's So Special About Working at Morrison-Maierle?
Surrounded by the beauty of the western United States, Morrison-Maierle has offices throughout Montana, Wyoming, Washington, and Arizona. We strive to give our employee-owners work-life balance so they can advance their careers in some of the most desirable locations in the country. 

As an employee-owned firm, Morrison-Maierle recognizes that its success, measured in growth and profitability, is the direct result of the contribution and commitment of our employee-owners.  The responsibility of ownership is part of our culture and we believe employees should benefit from their efforts and contributions to the firm through an ownership stake in the Company.

Morrison-Maierle is a community-minded company that encourages its employee-owners to become involved in organizations with local and personal significance. We follow our Core Values of integrity, respect, commitment, and excellence in everything we do.

Apply online at www.m-m.net.

Description:
Job Description

Gravitec's Engineering Department is seeking a talented Project Engineer for our world-class facility located in Poulsbo, WA. Fall protection is a growing field with room for advancement, challenging work and diversity. The ideal candidate for this position should enjoy working with their hands and have a desire to oversee all aspects of a project from design development through installation completion. Continuing education and professional advancement cover a wide range of opportunities including: design, installation, testing and research and development. Candidates should have experience working in a fast-paced office environment, strong problem solving skills, effective communications skills, attention to detail, excellent organizational skills and be familiar with the operation of various power and hand tools. This individual must be comfortable working at height and able to work both independently as well as in a team environment. This is a position that requires dedication and fastidious nature as we design, develop and install systems that people will depend on to save their lives.

Company Profile

Gravitec Systems, Inc. has been an industry leader in the field of fall protection for over 30 years, working with owners, architects, and contractors to provide innovative turn-key engineering and training solutions for our clients' fall protection needs, worldwide. Falling is one of the leading causes of fatality, both on the job and at home, and our clients continue to rely on our expertise because we provide the highest quality of protection for their workers.

Responsibilities

• Designing engineered fall protection solutions.
• Preparing structural design calculations.
• Working directly with Drafters to prepare construction documents.
• Perform analysis of existing systems and structures.
• Reviewing designs for compliance with engineering principles, company standards, and customer contract requirements and related specifications.
• Development of hazard assessment surveys.
• Inspections of existing fall protection systems.
• Installation of fall protection systems.
• This position includes frequent travel.

Qualifications

• Minimum of 6 years engineering experience.
• P.E. preferred or E.I.T with progress to P.E.
• Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (ABET Accredited) - Civil, Mechanical, Structural or other discipline dealing with physical structure.
• Familiarity with civil/structural engineering plans.
• Ability to effectively work as part of an engineering and installation team.
• Strong technical background and analytical abilities.
• Experience designing with various construction materials including steel, wood and concrete.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
• Experience with fall protection a plus.
• Ability to work independently with little supervision as well as on, and/or leading a team.
• Must be able to pass a drug screening.

Other helpful experience

• Previous experience with fall protection
• Working knowledge of current industry software including AutoCAD, MS office, RISA-3D a plus

Benefits

• Salary Rate commensurate with experience.
• Medical / Dental / Vision plan.
• 401(k) savings opportunity.
• Paid Vacation and Holidays.
• Tremendous growth potential with a leader in an ever-expanding market.

Reports to: Director of Engineering
FLSA Status: Exempt / Full Time

For consideration for this position, apply at www.gravitec.com. Please include your cover letter, resume, salary requirements, and reference this position title. Any applicants that fail to submit the requested information will not be considered.

If you have any questions, please contact our Human Resources Department for additional information. Gravitec is committed to providing a non-discriminatory employment environment for its applicants and employees. We ensure equal opportunities for qualified applicants and employees regardless of minority, gender, disability, or veteran status.

Position Overview:

This full time contract Energy Efficiency Engineer position resides in the Energy Efficiency Services Group (PEJD) within the Power Services (P) business line at Bonneville Power Administration (BPA). BPA Energy Efficiency advances the efficient use of energy throughout the Pacific Northwest by working with utility customers, trade allies, industry, and other partners. This engineering position will support BPA and our customers in meeting the 7th Power Plan targets throughout the Pacific Northwest. This position is located in Seattle, Washington.

Position Responsibilities:

Provide energy efficiency project engineering and highly knowledgeable technical expertise while serving on  BPA's conservation service teams: 
Perform outreach and customer service duties associated with developing and implementing energy efficiency projects, creating new measure offerings, performing measurement and verification, and providing technical oversight.
Visit utilities and end-users to develop energy efficiency projects recommendations.   Work with the utility and/or end user to help solve energy efficiency problems or look for solutions where energy efficiency can benefit both the end user and utility. 
Present and help BPA management promote the energy efficiency program and provide proactive customer service.  The potential audience for presentation may include; utilities, federal agencies, trade allies (contractors, equipment vendors, distributors) and industry associations. This could be via phone, web or in person.
Serve as part of a team advancing BPA's energy efficiency offering for commercial buildings, HVAC technologies, building controls and refrigeration in both new construction and retrofits.
Design, model and analyze mechanical systems for review/final approval by BPA project manager and/or designated staff members.
Analyze systems and processes, including heat transfer, fluid dynamic and thermodynamic principles for energy efficiency improvements.  Provide recommendations for improvements to BPA project manager and/or designated staff members for final review and approval.
Design commercial and industrial HVAC&R systems for energy efficiency, for review/approval by BPA project manager and/or designated staff members.
After EE system(s) installation, verify and document system performance to defined objectives and criteria.
Conduct energy savings calculations and create energy models (i.e. DOE 2.2) utilizing data analysis methodologies.   Energy models are used to determine potential savings of new equipment, building retrofits or new construction. Different models are used for pre to post comparison of utility bills to determine energy savings.
Identify, develop and manage energy efficiency projects with oversight of BPA project manager and/or designated staff members. 
Verify customer satisfaction with project progress/completion.
May facilitate the following:
Project scoping.
Project development.
Technical analysis.

Position Requirements:

Education/Experience:

Bachelor's degree in engineering required. 
Mechanical engineering degree is preferred.
Electrical, process/ industrial degrees or a directly related technical/engineering degree will be considered. 
5 - 7 years of demonstrated experience in energy efficiency engineering is required. 
6+ years and PE license is preferred. 
Minimum of 1 year proven experience in sales and customer service is highly desired.
Minimum of 1 year of demonstrated project management experience is highly desired. 
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite Software including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook; (MS Office 2010 proficiency required).

Technical Requirements:

Proven ability to design, model and analyze mechanical systems.
Proven ability to analyze systems and process with heat transfer, fluid dynamic and thermodynamic principals for energy efficiency improvements.
Experience with design and commissioning of commercial & industrial HVAC&R systems for energy efficiency.
Experience with energy savings calculations, energy models (i.e. Energy Plus) and data analysis methodologies.
Proven project management skills.

"We Are Builders. We create jobs and careers by building products that excite us - and that others are pleased to buy. We do this in a manner in which our parents and our children would be proud." - Clif McKenzie, Watson CEO
 
Surrounded by towering Douglas Firs, our fully integrated manufacturing and administrative offices tread softly on a 34 acre apple orchard in the Puget Sound Region. Watson is one of the few thriving West Coast furniture manufacturers still in existence today. We design and build agile workplace solutions for some of the largest, most dynamic companies in the world and have done so for over half a century.  We make each product in our manufacturing facility with methods rivaling the best. Watson designs are user driven and delivered with a modern environmental sensibility. 


JOB DESCRIPTION
The Space Planning Specialist is a critically important member of our Client Services and Sales Operations teams. This position is responsible for designing creative furniture layouts using our products to solve client challenges. The Design Specialist works collaboratively with Sales Reps, Account Managers and Engineers to determine the best solution based on a variety of considerations.

Secondarily, the Interior Design Specialist will foster a deep understanding of our product and manufacturing capabilities to recommend custom furniture solutions, as appropriate.  This knowledge will also be leveraged to collaborate with customer service representatives to diagnose existing product issues.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & JOB DUTIES:
Design and Layout:
•	Design and communicate compelling furniture layouts that delight our customers.
•	Understand relevant customer hardware and software technology to best incorporate into the furniture.
•	Apply best practices for circulation design, ergonomic design and ADA guidelines
•	Exercise creativity and a keen eye for aesthetics to advise design solutions for customers

Customer Service:
•	Demonstrate pride and confidence in producing customer facing documents that excite our customers
•	Practice sound organization and task management to ensure 100% on-time delivery of client requests
•	Proactively communicate with project teams to maximize client satisfaction

Maintain and Improve Resources
•	Advise and implement improvements to the product catalog
•	Develop a deep understanding of relevant software tools to continuously improve workflows and deliverables
•	Recommend product design improvements based on experience and customer feedback

SKILLS / COMPETENCIES
•	Ability to read architectural drawings and understand basic spatial concepts
•	Experience with CAD drawing software (AutoCAD, Revit or SketchUp preferred)
•	Background in multi-disciplinary design or cross-departmental collaboration
 
EXPERIENCE
•	Demonstrated design experience or education 
•	Familiarity with interior or furniture design best practices
•	Ability to effectively utilize software tools to communicate and space plan 
•	Basic understanding of manufacturing processes and environments preferred
•	Patience and the desire to ensure each client feels like a top priority by providing the highest level of customer service.

TO APPLY
Submit applications to www.watsonfurniture.com/careers under the Current Positions link.  Applications will only be processed through our website.

Watson's an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals, including minorities, women, veterans & individuals with disabilities. Watson will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all federal, state, and local ordinances.

Description:
Farallon Consulting, L.L.C. has an immediate opening for a full-time Project or Associate Level Engineer in its Issaquah, Washington office.

Farallon's outstanding reputation for resolving challenges on a broad array of environmental projects is the result of the expertise and dedication of highly motivated professionals working collaboratively with each other, our clients, and the regulatory community toward a common goal. Farallon is committed to recruiting high-quality people to join our team, listening to their aspirations, and encouraging professional growth so both our clients and team members benefit. 

Farallon provides an integrated suite of environmental consulting and engineering services to a wide range of private- and public-sector clients. Specialty areas include environmental due diligence, upland and in-water site characterization/remediation services, stormwater compliance/management, mediation/litigation support, and natural resources management. The firm is headquartered in Issaquah, Washington, with branch offices in Seattle and Bellingham, Washington; Portland, Bend, and Baker City, Oregon; and Oakland, Sacramento, and Irvine, California.
 
POSITION SUMMARY

The Project to Associate Level Engineer provides engineering support on a variety of projects encompassing the existing service areas. Project work includes construction management support, evaluation of remediation technologies, remediation design/implementation, stormwater compliance/design, landfill gas system design and maintenance, sediment cleanup, vapor intrusion mitigation, and other engineering work to support the needs of our clients. The position also involves collaboration with engineers throughout Farallon's offices both on projects and developing a vision for the future of Farallon's engineering services.  Candidates will coordinate and/or perform field work at project sites, provide supporting data and/or documentation for reports, and potentially manage select phases of a project.   

Requirements and Qualifications

•	Minimum 3-7 years of experience directly related to construction management, remediation technology evaluation/implementation, and/or stormwater compliance/management.
•	BS or MS in civil, environmental, or related engineering field.
•	P.E. license or Engineer in Training eligibility.
•	Valid driver's license and safe driving record.
•	Computer skills, including working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite with emphasis on MS Word and MS Excel. AutoCAD experience preferred but not required.  
•	Demonstrated skills in clear and professional written and verbal communication.
•	Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team.
•	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
•	Detail-oriented with a high degree of accuracy.
•	Ability to work independently on assigned tasks as a well as accept direction on given assignments.
•	Demonstrated ability to follow detailed instructions.

Responsibilities

•	Remediation technology evaluation and design development, including pilot study design/implementation, final design/implementation, remediation technology management, permitting, bid/contract document support, engineering drawings/calculations, and/or construction management for excavation work.
•	Stormwater compliance, including supporting development of Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plans, Spill Prevention Control and Countermeasure Plans, stormwater system compliance monitoring, and best management practices application.
•	Interaction with clients and regulatory agencies.
•	Ability/willingness for short-term travel to work sites in Washington and at times other West Coast locations.
•	Ability to complete physical field work in an outdoor environment. 
•	Ability to manage engineering-specific tasks or projects with the support of the Project Principal.

Benefits

Farallon Consulting offers competitive wages and benefits, including:

•	Medical, Dental, Vision, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, and Life Insurance 
•	Vacation/Sick/Holiday Pay
•	401k with Employer Matching
•	Flexible Spending Program
•	Employee Stock Ownership Plan that provides ownership interest in Farallon at no cost to employees  

If you would like to be considered for this position with the Farallon team, submit a resume online at .

Farallon Consulting is an EEO employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, genetic information, age (except for bona fide occupational qualifications), sex, pregnancy (including childbirth or a related medical condition), disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, military leave or service, status as a disabled veteran or other covered veteran status, participation in EEO protected activity, any other status protected by federal, state, or local law, or association with a person on the basis of one or more of the foregoing.
