Description:
PIERCE COLLEGE 
A Community College District in Puyallup and Lakewood, Washington 
invites applications for the position of: 

District Director of Maintenance and Custodial Operations 

SALARY: $75,582.00 /Year 
OPENING DATE: 11/07/17 
CLOSING DATE: 11/21/17 05:00 PM 

POSITION SUMMARY: 
Collaboration. Mentorship. A place to dream and achieve. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Pierce College. As one of the nation's leading colleges, Pierce is growing and advancing the future of education through our mission; creating quality education opportunities for a diverse community of learners to thrive in an evolving world. We're looking for a talented Maintenance Director to join our team, grow with us, and realize possibilities. 

Reporting to the District Director of Facilities and Construction Management, and working as part of a District-wide Facilities and Operations team, this position actively supports and engages in Pierce College's goals for equity and inclusion in order to provide access and support for our diverse community of learners. The Director of Maintenance and Custodial Operations provides administrative direction and oversight of the daily operations of the Maintenance, Grounds, and Custodial Departments at both Pierce College Fort Steilacoom and Pierce College Puyallup. The incumbent will provide support to the District Director in planning and conducting capital repair projects; strategic planning; emergency management and preparedness; and ensuring regulatory compliance. 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 
Facility Operations Administration: 

• Provide leadership of District Maintenance, Grounds, and Custodial operations. 

• Support department managers in administering personnel processes to include recruitments, recommendations for hiring, and disciplinary actions in accordance with Pierce College District administrative policies and procedures and in compliance with the Collective Bargaining Agreement between Pierce College and the Washington Public Employees Association (WPEA). 

• Facilitate teambuilding and professional development training for staff and ensure completion of required training and certifications. 

• Maintain a high level of standards and proficiency. Develop and implement processes and procedures to improve efficiencies and productivity to include introduction of new technologies, where feasible, in keeping with industry best practices. 

• Provide oversight of Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS). 

• Coordinate development and use of digitizing process and electronic filing system for capital plans and records. 

• Monitor department work assignments. 

• Develop improved design standards and specifications for equipment and systems with emphasis on maintainability and serviceability. 


General Administration and Support: 
• Develop and maintain strong working relationships with regulatory jurisdictions. 

• Ensure compliance with building codes and other relevant jurisdictional codes and regulations to include ADA accessibility standards. 

•Coordinate with Facilities department managers in identifying and 	 implementing non-capital repair projects. 

•Develop on-call services and emergency support agreements with vendors and service providers. 

•Assist in planning capital repair, remodel, renovation, and new construction projects to include preparation of Facility Condition Surveys. 

•Provide coordination with District Events Manager, as necessary, for event support requirements. 

•Assist in communicating with campus community regarding impacts of repair projects to college operations. 

•Provide input to the Director of Facilities for strategic planning and direction. 


Fiscal Oversight: 
• Oversee operating budget to include reviewing and monitoring expenditures and collaborate with District Director and with Finance Department representatives in development of annual fiscal year budget. 

• Ensure compliance with College policies and procedures regarding fiscal accountability. 

• Administer Purchase Card program for Facilities departments. 

• Assist department managers in obtaining quotes and bids for non-capital projects. 


Occupational Safety and Health Program: 
• In collaboration with the District Safety Officer, provide support for the District Occupational Safety and Health Program to include risk assessments, support for regulatory compliance requirements, training, and activities. 

• Ensure knowledge of and compliance with Accident Prevention Programs as they pertain to areas of responsibility to include fall protection, confined space, lock-out/tag-out, hazardous materials storage, handling and disposal, blood borne pathogens, etc. 

• Possess working knowledge of Occupational Safety and Health Act (OSHA) and Washington Industrial Safety and Health Act (WISHA) regulations. 


Emergency Management: 
• In support of the District Director of Facilities and in collaboration with the District Director of Campus Safety, engage in emergency management and preparedness activities and functions. 

• Assess logistical support requirements for facility operations in pre-planning and in response to emergency situations. 

• Serve as essential personnel during suspended operations and/or emergency incidents and may be required to report to or remain on-site during emergencies. 


Special Assignments: 
• As directed, perform special assignments including, but limited to, support for personnel investigations related to misuse of state resources and investigations as to root cause and corrective actions to be taken associated with accidents and failure to comply with the District Accident Prevention Program. 

• Participate in shared governance by serving on District and College committees. Prepare periodic reports. 

• Other special duty assignments as required. 


QUALIFICATIONS: 

Required Education: 
• Bachelor's Degree in facilities management, business, or a closely related field OR an Associate's Degree and two (2) years of direct related experience.  

Required Experience: 
• Five (5) or more years of progressively responsible management experience. 

• Five (5) or more years of experience in areas such as facility operations and maintenance, capital project management, and personnel management. 

• Demonstrated ability to build rapport and relationships, and work effectively with diverse populations. 

• Excellent communication skills. 

• Proficient with Microsoft Office products. 

• Demonstrated ability to work with confidential and sensitive materials and issues. 

• Skilled conflict management and resolution skills. 


Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 

• Skillfully enables employees to grow and succeed by creating and fostering a culture that focuses on measurable outcomes; setting clear, meaningful, and attainable goals and expectations; and, promoting and generating an atmosphere of cooperation. 

• Ability to earn the trust and respect of others through consistent honesty and professionalism in all interactions; maintaining high personal standards of honesty and truthfulness; respecting the opinions and assessments of others; maintaining confidentiality during investigations and personnel matters; and, taking personal responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work and achieving results with little oversight. 

• Skillfully demonstrates effective financial accountability by ensuring appropriate processes are in place and adhered to that provide adequate internal control and fiscal oversight of assigned financial resources; monitoring expenditures in keeping with appropriate policies and procedures; and, ensuring expenditures are in line with budgeted funding limits. 

• Demonstrates ability to effectively interact and communicate by maintaining an open, approachable manner, and treating others fairly and respectfully; possessing excellent communications skills; using effective listening skills and applying effective written and oral communication techniques to convey clear, timely, and persuasive messages; and, demonstrating effective presentation communication skills. 

• Demonstrates ability to think critically, creatively, and reflectively by using analysis and critical thinking skills to solve problems; ensuring decisions are aligned with strategic direction of the organization; and, showing insight into root-causes of problems while generating solutions and courses of action. 

• Ability to promote cooperation, commitment and positive relationships to achieve goals by	  helping teammates who need or ask for assistance; encouraging team unity through sharing information and expertise; working together to solve problems; and, supporting fair treatment and equal opportunity for all. 

• Demonstrates a working knowledge of the principles of open-mindedness, inclusion, multicultural perspectives and multiple ways of knowing, thinking and being by helping create a work environment that embraces and appreciates diversity; seeing the value of cultural, ethnic, gender, and other individual differences in people; striving to eliminate barriers to diversity; and, fostering a climate of inclusion. 

• Ability to adapt to changing business needs, conditions, and work responsibilities by responding positively to change; embracing and using new practices or values to accomplish goals and solve problems; coping and helping others deal with the ongoing demands of change; and, maintaining composure in stressful or adverse situations. 

• Ability to diplomatically handle challenging or intense interpersonal situations by working through circumstances in a positive and professional manner. 

• Ability to exercise tact and discretion in conversations while sharing information with others. 

• Adheres to all applicable workplace ergonomic and occupational safety regulations, standards, and practices by engaging in correct ergonomic practices; performing work in a safe manner at all times; and, using, maintaining, and inspecting Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), as applicable. 


Special Requirements: 
• Possess valid Washington State Driver's License. 

• Prior to a new hire, a background check including criminal record history will be conducted. Information from the background check will not necessarily preclude employment but will be considered in determining the applicant's suitability and competence to perform in the position. 

• Within three (3) months of employment successfully complete Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) Independent Study Courses IS-100.HE: Introduction to the Incident Command System for Higher Education and IS-200.b: ICS for Single Resources and Initial Action Incidents. 


APPLICATION PROCESS: 

Application Requirements: 
To be considered for this position, you must: 

• Meet the required qualifications as outlined this announcement. 

• Complete the online application profile at . 

• Apply for the specific job opening. 

• Upload (attach) a cover letter that addresses how you meet the required and desired qualifications as outlined in this announcement. Be sure to provide specific examples to support your experience, training and/or skills. 

• Upload (attach) a detailed resume. 

• Transcripts are not required to apply for this position, however, if you are selected for an interview, you will be asked to bring copies of unofficial transcripts showing completion of the required level of education. Unofficial copies of all college and university transcripts must include degree received and confer date. International transcripts must include a foreign transcript evaluation. For a list of approved credential evaluation services visit: www.naces.org/members.htm (Transcripts) 

• A list of at least two professional references with names, addresses, telephone numbers, and e-mail addresses. Letters of recommendation will not be accepted.(References) 


Special Note: All application materials must be submitted by 5 p.m. on the deadline date. 

Terms of Employment: 
This is a full-time (40 hours per week) administrative-exempt district position with Pierce College. The primary work location will be at Pierce College Fort Steilacoom, but travel to Pierce College sites will occur. Work hours are Monday through Friday 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., with occasional evenings as required. All positions may be subject to reassignment between campuses or sites. 

Physical Work Environment: 
This position is required to work indoors in an office environment. 

Reasonable Accommodation: 
Applicants with disabilities who require assistance with the application and employment process will be accommodated to the extent reasonably possible. Requests should be made to the District Human Resources Office by calling 253-964-7342. A telecommunication device for the deaf is available at (253) 964-6228. 

Screening & Interview Process: 
Only those candidates who have complied with the application process and meet the required qualifications will be considered. The most desirable candidates will be contacted for an interview. 

Salary & Benefits: 
The base salary for this position is $75,582.00 annually, dependent upon qualifications. Your paycheck is just part of the total compensation package. There is an outstanding benefits package which is worth an additional value equivalent to about 30% of your salary. A comprehensive health care benefits package for you and your dependents includes medical, dental and vision insurance. Life and long-term disability insurance plans; vacation, sick and personal leave; reduced tuition; and retirement benefits are also provided. 

Conditions of Employment: 
• In compliance with the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986, proof of authorization to work in the United States will be required at the time of hire. 

• Pierce College has adopted a Drug Free Workplace policy. As a condition of employment, employees must agree to abide by the requirements established in that policy. 


The Pierce College District is an equal opportunity employer. The Board of Trustees and Pierce College District are committed to providing equal opportunity and will not discriminate in terms and conditions of employment and personnel practices for all persons without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, presence of sensory, mental or physical disability, and status as a disabled veteran, or Vietnam-era veteran. 

Questions may be directed to: 
Vice President of Human Resources, Affirmative Action Officer or the Title IX Coordinator at (253) 964-7342. 
For more information or assistance, contact Human Resources at: jobs@pierce.ctc.edu

Description:
Since its founding in 1986, American Home Builders, Inc. (AHB) has built more than 60 commercial projects with a total value in excess of $1 Billion.We have been family owned and operated, since day one!




As a part of the American Capital Group Family of Companies, AHB is able to take full advantage of our vertically integrated real estate development system. Our strict adherence to excellence has enabled us to become one of the nation's leading private developer-builders.




We offer competitive benefit packages including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, paid holidays and generous vacation, advancement opportunities and Bonuses!!




We are looking to add a Project Engineer to our growing team!




Job Duties and Responsibilities




The Project Engineer is responsible for assisting in reviewing plans; estimating labor and materials, including material suppliers and sub-contractors; securing the lowest competitive bids for all aspects of construction on the assigned projects; maintaining documentation and accurate records
•Bidding : Contacting all utilities, city, county and other appropriate agencies to determine required fees and/or charges for the project
•Planning : Assisting in preparing and updating all assigned project schedules, including subcontractors and material deliveries
•Organization and quality control** : Assist in identifying problems or potential problems as they relate to the organization of the job; prioritizing tasks to provide a smooth flow of progress throughout the project; overseeing the tasks and responsibilities assigned to employees and subcontractors; making frequent visits to the project site, verifying that the site is organized and clean, and that satisfactory progress is being made in order to meet the established completion target.
•Communication : Providing all documentation to the President related to the project, including daily logs, phone logs, billing information, back charges, and change orders; writing informative memos, providing a record of what has happened or is expected to happen on the project.
•Billing : Providing bookkeeper with coded invoices, verifying the amounts on the invoices are in accordance with the purchase orders and that the portion being billed is correct; verifying vendor payments
•Safety and Security to include : assist in verifying that the project has a complete inventory of tools on file and that the tools are being maintained; enforcing the Company Safety and Security Policy and Procedures on the project site at all times.
•Goals include : assist in completing the entire project on time or ahead of schedule, and in or under budget; maintaining the established Company Quality Standards.

To learn more about American Home Builders visit our website at: www.acg.com.

Description:
THE COMPANY:
As part of Cadence Aerospace, PMW Operations provides CNC machining and assembly services to the aerospace industry.  We specialize in large, complex, hard metal machined parts.

Our company is committed to excellence, and we recognize that the right people, offering their ideas and expertise, will enable us to continue our success.  PMW seeks team members who are passionate, adaptable, driven to achieve quality results, focused on continuous improvement, self-motivated and problem solvers.  Equally important as education, training and experience required for the job, applicants must also meet our Workplace Expectations standards.  It is by these standards that we hold each other accountable to excellence in everything we do.

THE OPPORTUNITY:
We are seeking an experienced CNC Programmer with Vericut and Unigraphics experience to join our team.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
•	Support AS9100 Audits and ensure compliance to established standards.
•	Programming Translation - Translate drawings and electronic data into part programs such that geometry and labor standards are met.
•	Schedule and Hours Targets - Ensure that part numbers you program are completed such that established schedules are met, and programming and prove-out hours meet estimated budgets as follows:
•	Estimating - Assist the engineering department develop part estimates such that accurate and timely bidding packages for customer RFQ's are created.
•	Technological Advances - Know and understand the State-of-Technology in metal machining and Information Technologies, utilizing a GAP analysis matrix, so that a Capital Asset recommendation can be made to the Executive Leadership when required.
•	Data Integrity / Data Field Population - Ensure that specified fields have been properly filled in so that systems are able to generate information properly.                                                                                                                                                                                                                               Budgets - Keep informed of annual departments budgets such that department financial spending targets are being met 
•	Training - By the start of each fiscal year, assure you have developed plans defined with action items and schedules such that essential job skills are being improved.  Plans are in place by July 1 and are completed on schedule.     
•	Audits - Understand the requirements/procedures as defined in the Programming CAD/CAM manual and the Engineering Procedures manual so that you could answer any audit questions involving said manual.

OUTCOMES WHEN JOB IS DONE WELL:
•	New and existing part development will occur per established schedules and budgets
•	Production will have the methods to consistently manufacture parts to established labor and quality standards
•	Our lean enterprises will have manufacturing methods that meet key lean principles
•	Required ERP system information will be complete and accurate
•	External Customers will perceive PMW as a technologically competent supplier
•	New technology advances will be integrated when appropriate
•	The cost of producing existing production parts will continually be reduced
•	The overall 'Span time' of existing production parts will be reduced

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
•	Capable of utilizing customer drawings and/or solid models and develop CNC programs to produce parts that meet Engineering requirements.
•	Must possess exceptional measuring and blueprint reading abilities, the ability to analyze dimensional results of prove-outs and effectively correct discrepancies,
•	Must be able to participate in cross-functional team activities that encompass bid review, engineering plan development, and manufacturing producibility.  
•	Ability to communicate with Union Journey Level personnel to problem solve and make improvements on the shop floor.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
•	7-10 years CNC Programming Experience of 4 and 5 Axis Machining centers
•	Previous machining experience with hard metals on 4 and 5 axis machines preferred
•	Working knowledge of metal removal cutting technology required
•	Experience with Unigraphics (minimum v.16)
•	Experience with Vericut
•	Modeling / tool design and drafting capabilities a plus
•	Associates Degree or equivalent preferred

QUALIFICATIONS:
The ideal candidate would have an associates degree, machining knowledge and experience, and at least 7 years of CNC Programming experience.  

TOTAL COMPENSATION: 
In addition to competitive base pay and a bonus incentive program, we also offer medical, dental, disability, life insurance, matching 401k, Commuting Options, and more.  With a local south end commute, competitive wages and benefits, career growth potential and a lot of small company fun, you will find PMW offers more than just a job.

Description:
Project Manager - Architect 

 
About the Position: The Project Manager - Architect serves as an institutional representative to manage the programming, pre-design, planning, design, construction, and acceptance of varied and complex, major and minor construction and other built-environment projects for Western Washington University.  This position works directly with clients, provides technical advice and services to University departments for their current and future building needs, and provides technical and program related direction and information to the University's Facilities Management construction and maintenance crews.  This position also oversees the work of consultants and contractors retained by the University on assigned design and construction projects. 
 
About the College/Department: This position is located within Facilities Development and Capital Budget in the Division of Business and Financial Affairs.  FDCB and the Division support Western's mission to bring together individuals of diverse backgrounds and perspectives in an inclusive, student-centered university that develops the potential of learners and the well-being of communities.  We encourage applications from women, people of color, people with disabilities, veterans, and other candidates from underrepresented backgrounds and with diverse experiences interested in this opportunity. 

Western Washington University, with over 15,000 students in seven colleges and the graduate school, is nationally recognized for its educational programs, students and faculty.  The campus is located in Bellingham, Washington, a coastal community of 83,000 overlooking Bellingham Bay, the San Juan Islands and the Cascade mountain range.  The city lies 90 miles north of Seattle and 60 miles south of Vancouver, British Columbia.  Western is the highest-ranking public, master's granting university in the Pacific Northwest, according to the 2017 U.S. News & World Report rankings.  
Position Responsibilities: 
Main Job Functions:
Work with clients to establish and verify program needs and budgets, establish design criteria which most effectively fits within this context, prepare working drawings and project manuals
Provide technical advice and services to University departments concerning their current and future built-environment needs
Provide technical and program related direction and information to the University's Facilities Management construction and maintenance crews
Conduct consultant selection process by issuing the advertisement for proposals, heading a selection committee, facilitating consultant review and interview process, recommending consultant selection, negotiating fees, and preparing the consultant agreement
Oversee work of consultants and contractors retained by the University on assigned design and construction projects
Meet with and keep clients and project committees informed of project process
Present project status to the Board of Trustees
Review pay applications, workmanship, and project compliance of contractors
Work with budget authorities
Work with public agencies and groups for master planning, neighborhood plans, etc. on behalf of the University
Represent the University to Federal, State and local planning and regulatory agencies by preparing the proper documentation required, issuing specific notices required, meeting with representatives of these agencies as required, attending public hearings and/or meetings as required
Ensure design and construction compliance with International Building Code, Fire Codes, Americans with Disability Act 9construciton portion) and other codes and regulations
Work with other project team members
Other Duties
Serve on internal department committees regarding maintenance and upkeep of records of all buildings, grounds, utilities and other built-environment belonging or leased to the University - especially drawings, specifications, studies, surveys, electronic media, database information, etc. located in the Physical Plant and University Archives
Participate in interview committees, other campus committees, professional affiliations, and other related activities 
 
Required Qualifications: 
Licensed architect or engineer in the State of Washington OR eligible for licensure in Washington by comity and obtainment of license within 3 months of commencing employment
Five years of experience as a licensed architect or engineer
Strong written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to manage time well and under pressure
Ability to handle multiple projects and responsibilities simultaneously
Ability to work effectively with diverse employees at all levels of the organization and outside agencies
Working knowledge of architecture, engineering, planning, construction and project management of public works and alternative public works projects
General knowledge of budgeting, and hazardous materials used in construction
Reliable transportation and the ability to travel regularly
 
Preferred Qualifications: 
Five or more years of architectural and/or engineering project management experience related to a University/Institutional setting
CAD proficient
LEED certified professional
Working knowledge of word processing, spreadsheets, relational databases, and page layout programs
 
Academic Emphasis: N/A

Title: Western Washington University Project Manager - Architect

Description:
Stuart Silk Architects seeks a part time salaried Staff Designer, who will work from their home office.  The ideal candidate will live within 30 minutes of our Wallingford office to easily attend meetings as needed.  

Salary commensurate with experience.  

Stuart Silk Architects is a Seattle architecture firm specializing in contemporary and traditional architecture in the Pacific Northwest.  The firm is committed to sustainable architecture and has designed a number of LEED projects.  We are organized into teams of two or three people and we are looking for candidates who are interested in working on all phases of the design and documentation.

Required qualifications:
•	Auto CAD, Sketch Up, Revit 
•	Master or Bachelor degree in Architecture
•	minimum 5 years custom residential experience

Please submit the following:
•	Portfolio 
•	Resume
•	References

Activities include:
•	all phases of a project including schematic design, design development, construction drawings and limited construction administration under the supervision of project manager
•	zoning, feasibility, entitlement
•	product research
•	3-D computer modeling
•	minimum 20 hours per week
•	attend meetings in our Wallingford office as needed

Stuart Silk Architects encourages and supports each employee's goals and professional development.
